Query module¶

class rnaiutilities.query.Query(db=None)[source]¶

Class for querying a database and composing result sets.

compose(from_file=None, study=None, pathogen=None, library=None, design=None, replicate=None, plate=None, gene=None, sirna=None, well=None, featureclass=None)[source]¶

Query a database of image-based RNAi screening features for cells/bacteria/nuclei. The query can use filters, so that only a subset is selected. A lazy result set is returned, i.e. a set of plate files that meets the filtered criteria.

Parameters:
  • from_file – file argument from Query.query to avoid excessive data base access. If not given does normal query. If given only uses from_file argument
  • study – filters by study, e.g. ‘infectx’/’group_cossart’/’infectx_published’
  • pathogen – filters by pathogen, e.g. ‘salmonella’/’adeno’/’bartonella’/’brucella’/’listeria’
  • library – filters by library, e.g. ‘a’/’d’/’q’
  • design – filters by design, e.g.: ‘p’/’u’
  • replicate – filters by replicate, i.e. a number
  • plate – filters by plate, i.e.: ‘dz44-1l’
  • gene – filters by gene, i.e.: ‘star’
  • sirna – filters by gene, i.e.: ‘l-019369-00’
  • well – filters by gene, i.e.: ‘a01’
  • featureclass – filters by featureclass, e.g. ‘nuclei’/’cells’/’bacteria’
Returns:

returns a lazy QueryResult
Return type:

QueryResult
insert(path)[source]¶

Insert meta information of an platewise RNAi screen to a database. For insertion the path leading to the meta files has to be provided. Meta information is then written to either a sqlite database if db is set, otherwise the DB connection defaults to a postgres DB that listens on port 5432.

Parameters:path (str) – the folder to the meta files
query(study=None, pathogen=None, library=None, design=None, replicate=None, plate=None, featureclass=None)[source]¶

Query a database of image-based RNAi screening features for cells/bacteria/nuclei. The result will be printed to stdout.

Parameters:
  • study – filters by study, e.g. ‘infectx’/’group_cossart’/’infectx_published’
  • pathogen – filters by pathogen, e.g. ‘salmonella’/’adeno’/’bartonella’/’brucella’/’listeria’
  • library – filters by library, e.g. ‘a’/’d’/’q’
  • design – filters by design, e.g.: ‘p’/’u’
  • replicate – filters by replicate, i.e. a number
  • plate – filters by plate, i.e.: ‘dz44-1l’
  • featureclass – filters by featureclass, e.g. ‘nuclei’/’cells’/’bacteria’
select(select, study=None, pathogen=None, library=None, design=None, replicate=None, plate=None, gene=None, sirna=None, well=None, featureclass=None)[source]¶

Submits a select query to a database of image-based RNAi screening meta features to get an overview over meta information. The query returns the result as a list of strings.

Parameter select can be any of the following choices:
  • study
  • pathogen
  • library
  • design
  • gene
  • sirna
  • well
  • featureclass
Parameters:
  • select (str) – the meta feature to select
  • study (str) – filters by study, e.g. ‘infectx’/’group_cossart’/’infectx_published’
  • pathogen (str) – filters by pathogen, e.g. ‘salmonella’/’adeno’/’bartonella’/’brucella’/’listeria’
  • library (str) – filters by library, e.g. ‘a’/’d’/’q’
  • design (str) – filters by design, e.g.: ‘p’/’u’
  • replicate (str) – filters by replicate, i.e. a number
  • plate (str) – filters by plate, i.e.: ‘dz44-1l’
  • gene (str) – filters by gene, i.e.: ‘star’
  • sirna – filters by gene, i.e.: ‘l-019369-00’
  • sirna – filters by gene, i.e.: ‘a01’
  • featureclass (str) – filters by featureclass, e.g. ‘nuclei’/’cells’/’bacteria’
Returns:

returns a list of strings from the query
Return type:

list(str)

QueryResult module¶

class rnaiutilities.query_result.QueryResult(tablefile_sets, **kwargs)[source]¶

Set of results derived from a database query.

dump(sample, normalize, fh=None)[source]¶

Print the result set of the database query to tsv or stdout. If a string is given as param fh prints to file, otherwise if None is given prints to stdout.

Parameters:
  • sample – number of samples to draw from every well or None
  • sample – int or None
  • normalize (list(str)) – a list of normalisation methods to use, e.g. like ‘zscore’. Options so far are ‘bscore’, ‘loess’ and ‘zscore’.
  • fh (str) – name of the file or None

Parser module¶

Main module (entry point) for parsing feature files and computing statistics regarding download/parsing.

class rnaiutilities.parser.Parser(config: rnaiutilities.config.Config)[source]¶

Class for parsing a folder of plates containing matlab files for the features.

download_statistics()[source]¶

Computes download statistics if all files given in config have been downloaded correctly.

featureset_statistics(outfile)[source]¶

Computes statistics between all possible screens for pairwise feature overlaps. The overlaps can be taken to decide which screens to include.

parse()[source]¶

Parses the plate file sets into raw tsv files.

parse_statistics()[source]¶

Computes parsing statistics.
